Converts a binary value to a list of text values split at lines breaks. If a quote style is specified, then line breaks may appear within quotes. If includeLineSeparators is true, then the line break characters are included in the text.
Converts a text value to a list of text values split at lines breaks. If includeLineSeparators is true, then the line break characters are included in the text.

Converts a list of text into a binary value using the specified encoding and lineSeparator.The specified lineSeparator is appended to each line. If not specified then the carriage return and line feed characters are used.
Converts a list of text into a single text. The specified lineSeparator is appended to each line. If not specified then the carriage return and line feed characters are used.

Splits the specified columns into a set of additional columns using the specified splitter function.
Creates a list of nested lists of column values from a table.
Converts a table into a list by applying the specified combining function to each row of values in the table.
Converts a table to a list of records.
Creates a list of nested lists of row values from a table.
Transforms column names by using the given function.
Applies transformation(s) of the form { column, transform }.
Applies type transformation(s) of the form { column, type } using a specific culture.
Transforms the rows of the table using the specified transform function.
Makes columns into rows and rows into columns.
Translates a set of columns in a table into attribute-value pairs.
Translates all columns other than a specified set into attribute-value pairs.
Creates or extends a table with user-defined handlers for query and action operations.
Creates a function that can be intercepted by a handler defined on a view (via Table.View).
Gets the relationships among a set of tables.
Returns a table of SQL tables and views from the Teradata database.
Returns the character at the specified position.
Returns the text value with all non-printable characters removed.
Concatenates a list of text values into one text value.
Returns whether the text contains the substring.
Returns the last characters of the text.
Indicates whether the text ends in the specified value.
Returns formatted text from a format string and arguments.
Creates a text value from the given value.
Decodes data from a binary form into text.
Inserts one text value into another at a given position.
Returns the number of characters.
Converts all characters to lowercase.
Returns the substring up to a specific length.
Returns a new, random globally unique identifier (GUID).
Returns text of a specified length by padding the end of the given text.
Returns text of a specified length by padding the start of the given text.
Returns the first position of the value (-1 if not found).
Returns the first position in the text value of any listed character (-1 if not found).
Capitalizes the first letter of each word.
Returns the substring found at offset.
Removes all occurrences of the given character or list of characters from the input text value.
Removes a count of characters starting at the given offset
Returns a text value composed of the input text repeated a specified number of times.
Replaces all occurrences of the given substring in the text.
Removes a range of characters and inserts a new value at a specified position.
Selects all occurrences of the given character or list of characters from the input text value.
Splits text into a list of text values based upon a specified delimiter.
Returns a list of text values, split on any of the characters in the delimiter.
Returns the start of the text.
Indicates whether the text starts with a specified value.
Encodes text into a binary form.
Returns a list of character values from the given text value.
Removes all leading and trailing whitespace.
Removes all trailing whitespace.
Removes all leading whitespace.
Converts all characters to uppercase.
Returns the last value of the hour.
Creates a time from the given value.
Creates a Time from local and universal Time formats.
Returns the hour component.
Returns the minute component.
Returns the second component.
Returns the first value of the hour.
Returns a record containing the Time value's parts.
Returns a textual representation of the Time value.

Adds a key to the given table type.
Returns a closed version of the given record type (or the same type, if it is already closed).
Returns the facets of a type.
Returns a type that represents functions with specific parameter and return type constraints.
Returns a type that represents records with specific type constraints on fields.
Returns a record with field values set to the name of the parameters of a function type, and their values set to their corresponding types.
Returns a number indicating the minimum number of parameters required to invoke the type of function.
Returns a type returned by a function type.
Returns true if a type is a nullable type; otherwise, false.
Returns whether a record type is open.
Returns an item type from a list type.
Returns the non nullable type from a type.
Returns an opened version of the given record type (or the same type, if it is already open).
Returns a record describing the fields of a record type with each field of the returned record type having a corresponding name and a value.
Replaces the facets of a type.
Returns a new table type with all keys replaced by the specified list of keys.
Returns the type of a column in a table.
Returns the possibly empty list of keys for the given table type.
Returns a table containing a description of the columns (i.e. the schema) of the specified table type.
Returns the union of a list of types.
Assemble a record into a URI query string.
Returns an absolute URI that is the combination of the input base URI and relative URI.
Encodes special characters in accordance with RFC 3986.
Returns the parts of the input absolute URI as a record.
Returns the sum of the two values.
Returns -1, 0, or 1 based on whether the first value is less than, equal to, or greater than the second one.
Returns the result of dividing the first value by the second.
Returns whether two values are equal.
Creates a strongly-typed value from a textual representation.
Returns a record containing the input's metadata.
Returns the product of the two values.
Evaluates a query against a target.
Returns whether two values are equal.
Strips the input of metadata.
Replaces the input's metadata information.
Returns the difference of the two values.
Returns the type of the given value.
